subject: location code: add new item interface to support more connections types
commitMessage:
location code: add new item interface to support more connections types

Provide informaiton on different types of physical connections.
Supporting:
 - Slot
 - Embedded

Only supporting these two options since it can be used to cover most
cases.

The location type can be used by the IPMI OEM or Redfish to represent
the physical location of the hardware. A client wrapper client around
IPMI/Redfish can use it along with physical location to determine/build
device path of the hardware.

Change-Id: I2a8cf408d52f2434bc0c7874f5006215fc7203f5
Signed-off-by: Willy Tu <wltu@google.com>

Patch Set 11:

I'm not thrilled with the name slot, as you don't generally call things like oculink / hdmi / USB ... slots. But a more abstract name like `ServiceablePort` or `Serviceable` isn't ideal either.

```
I'm not thrilled with the name slot, as you don't generally call things like oculink / hdmi / USB ... slots. But a more abstract name like `ServiceablePort` or `Serviceable` isn't ideal either.
```

Patch Set 13:

> I was just addressing William's comment on 
> ```
> I'm not thrilled with the name slot, as you don't generally call things like oculink / hdmi / USB ... slots. But a more abstract name like `ServiceablePort` or `Serviceable` isn't ideal either.
> ```
> 
> I thought that it might be too general?

If it isn't intuitive to call those things slots (USB, HDMI, etc.), and I agree it isn't, then we should just come up with another name for those.

If we find there is, for some reason, overlap in attributes between Slot (ex. PCIe slot) and external connectors (USB/HDMI) we can solve that later.
Patch Set 13: Code-Review+2

Patch Set 13:

Let's start with what we have here and refactor as needed as you end up with implementations.
Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as 846182e0017cd90d15cf586ed8398e345b20373b by Patrick Williams

Patch Set 14:

> Patch Set 13:
> 
> Let's start with what we have here and refactor as needed as you end up with implementations.

Ok, sounds good. thanks
Presumably this isn't used by the client directly.  Would this be a custom OEM IPMI interface?  Redfish?

yeah, not the users directly. I guess I was thinking of a wrapper client that will call IPMI or Redfish can use it to build the device path.

This will be used by the Redfish to show the ConnectionType for Physical Locations.

This would generally be handled using the xyz.openbmc_project.Item.X interface, where X is Drive/Board ect.  In fact, PCIe slot already exists:

https://github.com/openbmc/phosphor-dbus-interfaces/blob/495981805244269650bee13d1ee8f13543b2bc5a/xyz/openbmc_project/Inventory/Item/PCIeSlot.interface.yaml

ah, should we add an interface for each type?

Or have a happing a mapping of the existing items to a type.

---

You probably mean the first one, since a Board type can vary a lot in connection types.
It's really up to the maintainer here, but as a guess, I suspect that's what we would do.

sounds good. I'll have the Interface version first and revert to this if needed.

This version is really targeting Redfish... but the other method might be more suited for OpenBMC in general.

I can’t tell if these interfaces are intended to be free-standing items, which are inserted into a path hierarchy, or they really should be decorators.  This “embedded” one especially doesn’t seem like a free-standing item.

The three interfaces you’ve defined here are all connector types?  Should we create a connector subdirectory?

I dislike the name of this interface without additional context.  I understand if you’re trying to match Redfish, but as a casual investigator if I were to come across a file ‘Item.Embedded’ I’d really have no idea what it means.  I think we should strive to provide better context on this one.

These interfaces should be decorators that should only be used to determine the connection types. Maybe adding to Decorator folder is better? 

I put it here because `Connector` and `PCIESlot` are also an item here... which is also supported as a type. Maybe create a new Connector/Slot interface under Decorator.


Another approach that I am taking is having a property in LocationCode instead like
https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/phosphor-dbus-interfaces/+/43796/1

Yeah, looking at `Item.Embedded` doesn't make much sense. Maybe `Item.Connector.Embedded` is better.

Redfish supports, Slot, Bay, Connector, Socket, and soon Embedded

Maybe we can have 

Item.Connector
  |_Item.Connector.Bay
  |_Item.Connector.Connector
  |_Item.Connector.Socket
  |_Item.Connector.Slot
  |_Item.Connector.Embedded
Yes, I think a Connector subdirectory is reasonable and makes the interfaces more obvious.

Done. I have added it `xyz.Inventory.Connector.XXX`.

Please take a look.

I am only support Slot and Embedded for now since I don't know how common the other use cases are.
Can you expand on this more?

I don't exactly know what bay connection means. This is from Redfish, but they didn't provide much context.

If someone can give me context, that would be great.
I have removed this in favor of just support Slot and Embedded for now. We can add this if we need this.
An embedded component
